==Appendix A. Installation== ===How to obtain KTorrent=== KTorrent is part of the KDE project http://www.kde.org/. KTorrent can be found in the kdenetwork package on ftp://ftp.kde.org/pub/kde/, the main FTP site of the KDE project or at http://ktorrent.org/, KTorrent's web site. Your distribution may also provide packages. ===Requirements=== In order to successfully use KTorrent, you need KDE 1.1. Foobar.lib is required in order to support the advanced KTorrent features. KTorrent uses about 5 megs of memory to run, but this may vary depending on your platform and configuration. All required libraries as well as KTorrent itself can be found on The [ftp://ftp.kapp.org KTorrent home page]. http://www.kde-apps.org/content/show.php/KTorrent?content=26353 You can find a list of changes at http://apps.kde.org/KTorrent. ===Compilation and Installation=== [Section incomplete, please add what worked for you based upon your build.] ====Download==== You can find the downloads of all versions of Ktorrent at: * [http://ktorrent.org/?q=downloads Downloads] There are instructions for Mac OS X and additional notes there as well. ====Dependencies==== You will need several modules installed prior to being able to compile and install Ktorrent. In general you will need: make (KT 2.x) or cmake (KT 3.x) For specific variations of Linux you will need: For Ktorrent 2.x For Ktorrent 3.x on KDE 3 '''Ubuntu, Suse''' [Please list other flavours] *build-essential *kdelibs5-dev *libqca2-dev *libgmp3-dev *kdebase-workspace-dev *libplasma-dev *kdepimlibs *libboost-dev '''Mandriva''' [Please list other flavours] *gcc *gcc-c++ *gcc-cpp *kdebase4 *mandriva-kde4-config For Ktorrent 3.x on KDE 4 ====Compilation==== For Ktorrent 2.x 
tar -xvjf ktorrent-X.Y.tar.bz2
cd ktorrent-X.Y
./configure
make
make install
For Ktorrent 3.x 
tar -xvjf ktorrent-3.X.Y.tar.bz2
cd ktorrent-3.X.Y
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=`kde4-config --prefix` ..
make
sudo make install
For Specific flavours and KT versions: [http://ktorrent.org/forum/viewtopic.php?t=2714 Howto: Compile 3.2beta1 under Ubuntu-Intrepid (gnome)] ====Installation and First Startup==== [blank at the moment] ====Original Text==== [Not sure what to do with it. George, can you review this and delete it as appropriate?] In order to compile and install kmyapplication on your system, type the following in the base directory of the kmyapplication distribution: % ./configure % make % make install Since kmyapplication uses autoconf and automake you should have no trouble compiling it. Should you run into problems please report them to the KDE mailing lists. {{BookCat}}

They settled in Korean Peninsula, and lived on hunting, gathering berries, and so on. the primary nation of Korea was "Joseon<sub>It's a different nation of the same name.</sub> ", and it was located in the north of Korean Peninsula.

==Lessons== ===Unit One=== *{{stage short|100%|Dec 24, 2008}} [[Hebrew/Basic/1|Lesson 1]]: {{Hebrew|אֵיך קוֹרְאִים לך?}} — Greetings, names, welfare, genders. *{{stage short|100%|Dec 24, 2008}} [[Hebrew/Basic/2|Lesson 2]]: {{Hebrew|בֵּן כַּמָּה אַתָּה?}} — Numbers, ages, definite article, personal pronouns. *{{stage short|100%|Dec 24, 2008}} [[Hebrew/Basic/3|Lesson 3]]: {{Hebrew|דִּקְדּוּק בְּסִיסִי}} — Basic grammar: roots and radicals, prefixes, introduction to plurals. *{{stage short|100%|Dec 24, 2008}} [[Hebrew/Basic/4|Lesson 4]]: {{Hebrew|אֵיפֹה אַתָּה גָּר?}} — Place of living, introduction to verb conjugation, questions and interrogative pronouns. *{{stage short|100%|Dec 25, 2008}} [[Hebrew/Basic/5|Lesson 5]]: {{Hebrew|לְאָן אַתָּה נוֹסֵעַ?}} — Directions of travel, modes of transport, ''qal'' present tense conjugation, weak radicals. *{{stage short|100%|Dec 26, 2008}} [[Hebrew/Basic/Review 1|Review 1]] — Complete review of Unit One. ===Unit Two=== *{{stage short|75%|Dec 29, 2008}} [[Hebrew/Basic/6|Lesson 6]]: {{Hebrew|זֶה הַבַּיִת שֶׁלִי}} — Demonstrative pronouns, possessive pronouns, basic syntax. {{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|12-16|60+ minutes|4|[[Image:Layered_cake_with_rye_bread_2.jpg|300px]]}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Denmark]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Rugbrødslagkage''' (Danish for "rye bread layered cake") is a cake with whipped cream and layers having grated rye bread. Layered cakes of this type are eaten at birthday parties in Denmark, but this recipe with rye bread is quite rare though.
==Ingredients==
* 125g dark rye bread without sunflower seeds etc. * 6 eggs * 250 g sugar * 15 ml cacao powder * 15 ml potato flour * 5 ml baking powder * butter for greasing baking paper * 500 ml cream for whipping
==Procedure== ===Three days before serving === Leave a couple of slices of rye bread to dry outside of the fridge and without wrapping.
=== The day before serving ===
Grate the now-dry rye bread.
Turn on oven at 220C (for convection ovens: 200C).
Separate the eggs and beat the egg whites stiff. In a separate bowl, whip the egg yolk with sugar, cacao, potato flour, baking powder and grated rye bread. Carefully mix in the beaten whites with a spoon.
Baking: 10 minutes at 220C. Apply 1 cm thickness, on ''buttered'' baking paper in a cake form. Only in case of convection oven, more layers can be baked above each other. The dough should be enough for 4 or 5 layers.
Let the layers cool.
Whip two thirds of the cream and distribute it between the layers. Only just before serving should the top and the side of the torte be covered with whipped cream. Leave the cake in the fridge.
===Just before serving === Cover top and sides with whipped cream.
<gallery> Image:Grating rye bread.jpg|First step: grate the dry (!) rye bread Image:Beating egg whites before yolk.jpg| Beat egg whites first, then egg yolk Image:Baking cake layer 1.JPG| Prepare dough for a cake layer on buttered baking paper Image:Baking cake layer 2.JPG|After 10 min: A single baked cake layer File:Layered_cake_with_cream.JPG|Just before cutting! </gallery>
==Notes, tips and variations==
* Leaving the half-done cake in the fridge overnight improves the taste.

{{Chess Opening Theory/Position|= |Halloween Gambit| |rd| |bd|qd|kd|bd| |rd|= |pd|pd|pd|pd| |pd|pd|pd|= | | |nd| | |nd| | |= | | | | |nl| | | |= | | | | |pl| | | |= | | |nl| | | | | |= |pl|pl|pl|pl| |pl|pl|pl|= |rl| |bl|ql|kl|bl||rl|= || }} =Halloween Gambit= The Halloween or Müller-Schulze Gambit is an aggressive and complex gambit. White sacrifices a piece with the idea of central pawn storm, with the possibility of gaining time by driving back the black knights. ==Theory table== {{Chess Opening Theory/Table}}.
'''1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Nxe5'''
4 5 6 7 8 9 10 11
Nxe5
[[/4...Nxe5|Nxe5]]		 d4
Nc6		 d5
Bb4		 dxc6
Nxe4		 Qd4
Qe7		 Be3
Nxc3		 Qxg7
Nxd5		 c3
bxc3		 =/=+
...
..		 ...
Ng6		 e5
Ng8		 Bc4
d5		 Bxd5
c6		 Bb3
Bb4		 O-O
Bxc3		 bxc3
N8e7		 =+
...
Nxe4?!		 Qh5
Qf6		 Qxf7
Qxf7		 Nxf7
Kxf7		 Bc4
Ke7		 Nxe4
Nd4		 Bd3
+=
...
...		 ...
...		 ...
...		 ...
Nxf2		 Nxh8
Nxh1		 Nb5
Nb4		 Nxc7+
Kd8		 Nxa8
Nxc2+		 +=
